bibl.title: Letter from Francis C. Hall to Philip Showalter Hench, July 17, 1942

div1.p: Hall thanks Hench for the reprint of his article and praises Hench's speech on the yellow fever experiments, delivered at the American Rheumatism Association meeting.

div1.head: Letter from Francis C. Hall to Philip Showalter Hench, July 17, 1942
div1.opener:
372 MARLBOROUGH STREET
BOSTON
July 17, 1942
ROBERT B. OSGOOD, M. D.
FRANCIS C. HALL, M. D.
ROBERT J. JOPLIN, M. D.
JOHN A. REIDY, M. D.
--------
THEODORE B. BAYLES, M. D.
TELEPHONE
KENMORE 9400
CABLE ADDRESS
“MENISCUS”, BOSTON
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
Many thanks for the reprint
of the Yellow Fever Story. I am
mighty glad to have it.

Let me tell you again what
a swell job I think you did at the
Meeting of the American Rheumatism
Association, for your speech was full
of inspiration, humor, and the suspense
of a detective story.

Good luck to you in your mili-
tary work.
